title: Remote Sensing Data Scientist
description: [   At Lifescale Analytics, we help life science organizations optimize processes for the collection, management and analysis of research data. We have an opportunity for a  Remote Sensing Data Scientist  in  Raleigh, NC .  The ideal candidate will have a PhD or MS in GIS/ Remote Sensing, Computer Science or similar degree with 3 -5 years professional experience. The candidate should have a deep understanding of remote sensing and demonstrate experience working with and implementing ML/DL models. The candidate will be responsible for analyzing data from drone and satellite, developing algorithms for land cover classification, and working with developers and users to transition models to operational systems. A successful candidate will demonstrate enthusiasm for working in a small team of individuals with diverse technical backgrounds to rapidly solve complex problems.    The Employer will not sponsor applicants for any employment visas, at hiring or in the future, including but not limited to H-1B visas.      Responsibilities :  The successful candidate must demonstrate:  · Experience with using data from various remote sensing systems.  · Experience with satellite data assimilation techniques.  · Experience with ArcGIS, ENVI, QGIS, GDAL or Python for geospatial data processing.  · Experience in running Machine Learning and Deep Learning models using remote sensing data.  · Strong coding skills in Python and R.  · Perform spatial analysis and validation  · Ability to develop databases for remote sensing/geospatial projects  · Proficient documentation of applied scientific and technical research  · Excellent communication and technical writing skills.  · Ability to handle multiple tasks and coordinate with other team members effectively  · Strong data visualization skills   Qualifications:    · Experience with high-performance computing.  · Experience with AI software such as Tensorflow, PegaPlatform, Azure ML, Google Cloud AI, etc  · Experience working in Google Earth Engine and Descartes Labs platforms  · Experience with version control systems, such as Gitlabs or Bitbucket.  · PhD or MS in GIS/ Remote Sensing, Computer Science or similar degree with 3 -5 years professional experience.   Who we are  Lifescale Analytics helps life science organizations maximize the value of information assets to enable research innovation, increase efficiency, and ultimately improve the time that ideas in the lab come to life.  We provide the expertise for making observations, orienting data, analyzing information, and ultimately making decisions and taking action. Our specialists are skilled at managing, refining, analyzing or visualizing information for the specific purpose of increasing the value of IT for those in the life sciences industry. We achieve this through a progressive refinement of data along the analytics value chain. For more information, please visit our website at www.lifescaleanalytics.com  Job Type: Contract  Experience:   ArcGIS, ENVI, QGIS, GDAL: 3 years (Required)  Gitlabs or Bitbucket: 1 year (Preferred)  Python and R: 3 years (Required)  TensorFlow, PegaPlatform, Azure: 3 years (Required)  Machine Learning & Deep Learning: 3 years (Required)   Education:   Master's (Preferred)   Location:   Raleigh, NC (Required)   Work authorization:   United States (Required)   Contract Length:   More than 1 year   Contract Renewal:   Likely   Work Location:   One location    ]

title: Catastrophe Data Analyst
description: [   POSITION SUMMARY / OBJECTIVE  This position will leverage data management and risk management skills to assist IFG Companies in the evaluation and management of property and liability exposures. The position will be responsible for developing building, validating, and maintaining catastrophe exposure data; evaluating the catastrophe risk profile of individual property accounts; assisting in the evaluation and development of portfolio catastrophe risk management reports and assisting when needed on other risk management activities. The position will work closely and will provide support to underwriters within IFG Companies’ Property and Liability units.  POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES   Validating the quality and integrity of property exposure data and performing pre-processing modeling activities; including data consistency checks. Identify and automate workflows so as to build a unified consistent data collection mart.  Working with IFG Companies’ technology group to ensure data uniformity within the catastrophe risk modeling and rate making processes.  Supporting requests from underwriters to assess, evaluate and price catastrophe risk through the use of catastrophe risk model results.  Supporting the Actuarial unit in providing catastrophe risk reporting and effectively managing reinsurance programs.  Performing and Analyzing account and portfolio level catastrophe risk model runs.  Planning and organizing information with problem solving, decision making skills. Use of statistical models using R and Python is a plus.  Effectively communicate catastrophe exposure and risk analysis with the ERM and Underwriting teams.  Assist the ERM unit in performing operational risk review on people, processes, controls and systems.  Assist in the implementation and monitoring of IFG Companies’ risk limits.  Perform other duties as required.   KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS / ABILITIES   Ability to demonstrate planning and organizational skills.  Strong computer skills (Excel|Word|SQL) with demonstrated high accuracy output.  Experience with Python or R is a plus.  Excellent interpersonal and written/oral communication skills.  Excellent attention to detail.   EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE / CERTIFICATIONS   4 year degree in statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, economics, risk management or finance from an accredited college or university.  2-3 years’ pf experience in Data Analytics or Risk Analysis is required.  Background in Insurance is a plus.   PHYSICAL DEMANDS   Occasional travel, up to 20%, is required.   BENEFITS   We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), flexible spending, short-term and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, long-term care, education assistance and paid time off, including paid parental leave and a birthday holiday.   IFG Companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. M/F/D/V  Job Type: Full-time  Experience:   relevant: 3 years (Preferred)   Work authorization:   United States (Required)   Work Location:   One location   Benefits:   Health insurance  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Retirement plan  Paid time off  Flexible schedule  Tuition reimbursement  Professional development assistance   Schedule::   Monday to Friday    ]

title: Data Scientist
description: [     What you’ll be doing...    As a data scientist, you will be ensuring that analytics drive continuous business improvements, bringing more profitable growth and an even better customer experience. You’ll define the analytics strategy and champion that strategy across the business, in order to create buy-in for data-driven decision making. Your end goal is to recommend improvements that will go straight to the bottom line, by helping us serve our customers.    Partner with others to understand business challenges.   Design creative approaches to uncover the biggest opportunities for cost and time savings.   Define and drive the analytics strategy and modeling approaches.   Support business cases and translating findings into practical business implications.   Influence the adoption of analytics in decision making.     What we’re looking for...    You are a master at analyzing big data. You thrive in an environment where enormous volumes of data are generated at rapid speed. You’re a creative thinker who likes to explore and uncover the issues. You are decisive. Communicating what you’ve uncovered in a way that can be easily understood by others is one of your strengths. You are great at influencing up, down, and across groups.   You’ll need to have:    Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.   Four or more years of relevant work experience.   Experience in applying statistical ideas and methods to data sets to answer business problems.   Experience with visual science or dashboard design principles.   Experience with general purpose programming languages (Python, R, etc.)    Even better if you have:    Degree in mathematics, statistics, physics, engineering, computer science, or economics.   Experience with Tableau or similar visual analysis tool, optimization, analytics and large data sets, developing visually compelling interactive dashboards.   Project management experience.   Strong understanding of database concepts (Oracle, MS SQL, generic SQL, etc.).   Strong understanding of data warehouse and data lake architecture (Teradata, Hadoop).   Good understanding of third party analytic tools.   Experience with shell scripting tools in Windows, Linux/Unix is a plus.   Experience with data aggregating tools such as SPLUNK is a plus.     When you join Verizon...    You’ll have the power to go beyond – doing the work that’s transforming how people, businesses and things connect with each other. Not only do we provide the fastest and most reliable network for our customers, but we were first to 5G - a quantum leap in connectivity. Our connected solutions are making communities stronger and enabling energy efficiency. Here, you’ll have the ability to make an impact and create positive change. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, join our team of the best and brightest. We offer great pay, amazing benefits and opportunity to learn and grow in every role. Together we’ll go far.    Equal Employment Opportunity    We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.    ]

title: Principal Data Scientist
description: [     Your Opportunity     You will be responsible for analyzing tens of millions of customer interactions to find patterns that help improve the effectiveness of our marketing organization. Your day-to-day will contain a wide spectrum of the activities, from meeting with business stakeholders and understanding challenges and opportunities, to data wrangling and modeling, to producing effective visualizations that concisely deliver insight. You will be a go-to person in the organization for knowledge and insight on our data and potential uses and areas in which we can deploy it.     Our Ideal Candidate     You are a data driven, professional data scientist who has the ability to decompose ambiguous business questions into tractable problems to be answered through a range of data sources and analytical techniques. You have deep technical knowledge and the ability to turn mountains of data into digestible insights and data products. You enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative, global environment and moving a quickly-growing organization towards an even more promising future.     Your Responsibilities     Reporting to the Director – Marketing Insights and Analytics, you will:     Be a technical expert and partner with the organization to understand pain points and areas in which we can and should leverage data products and solutions.   Advocate for the continued propagation of advanced analytical and machine learning techniques within the business.   Build, deploy, and maintain ML models   Mentor more junior data scientists and analysts to grow the overall technical abilities of the team   Support ad hoc analytics requests as needed   Develop reports and/or presentations that concisely communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.      Your Qualifications     Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a field with a quantitative focus or a technical discipline    8+ years of relevant professional experience   8+ years of experience with a data science programming language (e. g. R, SAS, SPSS, and/or Python) (Python Preferred)   Experience with at least one data visualization tool (Tableau, Power BI, d3.js, GGplot, etc.)   Proficiency in SQL and relational databases   Experience with big data frameworks (Hadoop / Spark)   Strong applied statistics skills (statistical modeling & inference)   Consultative style; skilled in supporting internal customers   Strong project/time management and organizational skills     Preferred Qualifications     Masters Degree or PhD in Data Science or other quantitative field   10+ years experience as a Data Scientist or Business Analyst          At Informatica, We “DATA”. We Do Good, Act As One Team, Think Customer First, and Aspire For The Future. Informatica enables companies to unleash the power of data to become more agile, realize new growth opportunities, lead to new inventions resulting in intelligent market disruptions.      A career with Informatica gives you all the opportunities and benefits that can only come from working for the trusted industry leader, including amazing, energetic team members; a globally diverse workplace; and a company dedicated to your success, growth and advancement.    ]

title: Clinical Laboratory Data Analyst - LC-MS/MS
description: [    Job Description  How would you like to join a team of creative individuals dedicated to collaborating with doctors to provide the most accurate and rapid test results possible? Radeas is filled with exciting new ideas and cutting edge diagnostics, and you could be a part of our team.  The purpose of Radeas Laboratories is to bring radical ideas in analytical testing to the clinical laboratory. Applying unique analytical methods and a highly specific approach, Radeas can provide the best possible service to healthcare providers by offering laboratory methods that are sensitive, selective, and efficient.  Based on a foundation of quality service, transparency, and innovation, Radeas is looking for qualified individuals to join us as we grow and expand. Creative? Hardworking? Enjoy thinking outside the box? Then Radeas might just be the place for you.   SUMMARY : This position primarily performs routine data analysis and limited laboratory bench work related to a wide spectrum of clinical and/or analytic tests with the ability to work independently.   Duties include but are not limited to:     Conducts chemical analysis of body fluids, including blood, urine, oral fluid or spinal fluid, to determine presence of normal or abnormal components.    Analyzes laboratory findings to check the accuracy of the results.    Interprets raw data from the LC-MS/MS in order to determine results for each patient.    Requests and documents reruns for QCs or patient samples when raw data is unacceptable.    Conducts statistical analyses and evaluates test results relative to specimen information and established reference materials.    Captures patient results into report templates and checks templates, patient demographics, and results for errors and inconsistencies.    Monitors data collection, checking and ensuring data integrity to produce reports that both explain and summarize findings in ways that can be understood by lay and non-technical audiences.    Remains current on lab standard operating procedures.    Identifies and communicates to appropriate personnel quality control issues.    Manipulates potentially hazardous human specimens/samples and analytic reagents in a safe and responsible manner within the laboratory setting.    Follows all safety procedures and maintains safety equipment.    Performs, analyzes and documents all proficiency testing data produced by LC-MS/MS in the same manner as patient samples.    Assesses potential problems that may arise in testing and initiates appropriate action, as may be required.    Participates in regular in-service training and appropriate education on laboratory safety and testing procedures.    MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS    Education and/or Experience:     Bachelor’s degree in one of the following disciplines:  biology, chemistry, toxicology, clinical chemistry, or a relatable life science.     Position Type/Expected Hours of Work:     This is a full-time position, and days and hours of work are: M-F, 8am-5pm.    Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.    Travel:    Limited Travel - Travel is primarily local during the business day.   PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT   While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies, up to 20 pounds.  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $14.00 to $16.00 /hour  Radeas provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  Data analysis; laboratory technician; clinical laboratory scientist; medical laboratory technologist; medical laboratory scientist; confirmation scientist; LC-MS/MS; LCMS; HPLC; liquid chromatography; mass spectrometry  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $14.00 to $16.00 /hour  Education:   Associate (Required)   Application Question:   Do you have at least nine (9) credit hours of biology, nine (9) credit hours of chemistry, and an additional nine (9) credit hours of any combination of biology and chemistry for a total of 27 credit hours from an accredited college or university?   Additional Compensation:   Bonuses   Work Location:   One location   Benefits:   Health insurance  Dental insurance  Vision insurance  Retirement plan  Paid time off  Flexible schedule    ]

title: Data Analyst
description: [   Freight Handlers, Inc. is currently seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our BI team. This position will participate in the analysis and development of logical data base designs, data models and relational data base definitions across multiple computing environments. Assists in data management deliverables such as business need analysis, data source identification and analysis and data modeling techniques. You will also participate in the analysis and resolution of issues related to information flow and content with data stakeholders. Develops technical expertise in data modeling directions, methodologies, techniques and tools to ensure development of logical and relational data base designs which meet the needs of the business customers.     In this role you will:    Participate in the evaluation of business requirements.   Transform client requests into data deliverables to include data models, data mappings and data transformation rules.   Contribute to the development of project plans for data deliverables. Depicts moderately complex to complex ideas, issues and data designs to varied audiences.   Contribute to the development of project plans and supports development team throughout project lifecycle including during test phase researches test issues and data content and assists with moderately complex problem resolution.   Participate in the creation and implementation of new standards and procedures.   Investigates components of new tools and techniques.   Performs related duties as assigned or requested.          Qualifications:    Bachelor's Degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent technical expertise.   Minimum of 2 years related experience.   General knowledge in the following areas; IT concepts, strategies and methodologies, IT architectures and data standards, and general knowledge of a business function(s) and of business operations. Extensive knowledge of data design and tools required.   Proficiency in SQL and DBMS languages and tools; knowledgeable in new and emerging technologies.   Demonstrated attention to detail   Strong problem solving and logic skills, resourcefulness, needs to be able to interact with people across the organization and departments to resolve bugs/issues/understand their needs.   Goal orientated and driven for results to achieve the goals of the company by conveying a sense of urgency, driving issues to closure, and persisting despite obstacles and opposition.   Passion for helping the business achieve operational success.   Demonstrates understanding of key issues relevant to maintaining a healthy support environment through effective recommendations of products and services and keeps that knowledge up to date.   Exhibits good business ethics both internally and externally.   Maintain a working knowledge of advances and trends in programming and technology.   Ability to work varied hours to accommodate operational needs and provide after-hours support as necessary.   Ability to travel for special project assignments. title: Senior Data Scientist - NJ or Raleigh, NC
description: [    We’re looking for a senior data scientist to drive our data science and analytics group forward! You’ll be joining a group of curious, smart, technically minded yet business savvy data scientists and analysts looking to make a difference to the company by designing and building out our data decisioning capabilities from the ground up!   As a senior data scientist, you’ll work collaboratively with our business, operations, analytics, and IT teams. You’ll be responsible for conceptualizing, designing and building out decision making products for our business in the spaces of marketing / lead gen, business operations, and customer retention.   Our ideal candidate is excited to join our fast-paced culture and is excited to contribute to our growing data science practice!    What you’ll do:        Find new and improved ways for us to use data in our products, operations, and business strategies      Lead new projects and initiatives starting from understanding business to carrying out projects and presenting to stakeholders.      Design and execute data products in marketing, business operations, and customer retention spaces      Act as a subject matter expert with all things data      Work to build out the data science team as we grow     What we do:      We achieve competitive advantage through data-driven marketing and full management of the customer experience. We’re constantly refining our technology and our strategies, that’s why we’re the industry leader in delivering the best results to the top insurance brands in America.    That’s not just lip service either, we’re consistently awarded partner of the year from brands like AFLAC, Humana, and more. Our work has also been featured on The Dr. Oz Show, Forbes, and Vox - to name a few.    We want people who fit within our Be Real culture. We want a diversity of programmers and writers and designers and data scientists and strategists and more. We’re made up of introverts and extroverts, suits and rebels, corporate types and anti-corporate types. We’re an environment where every person feels their full potential is only limited by their ability to conceive of it and make it happen. Our company grew from entrepreneurial roots but has big company resources to get amazing things done.    What we’re looking for:        7+ years of experience in a data science role, building predictive algorithms and data products ideally related to marketing, business operations, or customer retention      Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms such as decision forests, logistic regression, k-means clustering, etc.      Ability to communicate findings clearly and deep understanding of your current business      Proficiency with Python, SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.)      Experience with big data platform (i.e. Hadoop)      Intensely curious – always asking questions and not being OK with the status quo. Obsessed with making things better and more efficient.      A lifelong learner that is excited to learn new data science technologies and apply those to technologies to our business      Ability to be objective and follow the facts, cut through noise and create a story with data.      Strong organizational skills including time and project management      Thrives in a fast-paced environment that is constantly changing      BS/MS in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.)        What’s in it for you:      Medical, dental, vision, paid time off/holidays, 401(k), and bonus opportunity      Frequent office events and outings      Employee development programs, conference and training reimbursement      Work remote flexibility      Joining a growing and exciting team making a big impact on the business!             TRANZACT, a     Willis Towers Watson Company    is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and voluntarily complies with the laws and regulations related to employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran or individual with a disability, ancestry, gender, gender identity or expression, or any other protected group status or non-job related characteristic protected by applicable human rights or equal opportunity legislation. We are a company that values diversity. As required by law, we must record certain information to be used as part of our Affirmative Action Program. In extending this invitation you are advised that (a) response data is used for periodic government reporting and will remain confidential within Human Resources department; (b) responses are used solely to help us comply with government record keeping, reporting and other legal requirements.     ]

title: Remote Sensing Data Scientist
description: [   At Lifescale Analytics, we help life science organizations optimize processes for the collection, management and analysis of research data. We have an opportunity for a  Remote Sensing Data Scientist  in  Raleigh, NC .  The ideal candidate will have a PhD or MS in GIS/ Remote Sensing, Computer Science or similar degree with 3 -5 years professional experience. The candidate should have a deep understanding of remote sensing and demonstrate experience working with and implementing ML/DL models. The candidate will be responsible for analyzing data from drone and satellite, developing algorithms for land cover classification, and working with developers and users to transition models to operational systems. A successful candidate will demonstrate enthusiasm for working in a small team of individuals with diverse technical backgrounds to rapidly solve complex problems.    The Employer will not sponsor applicants for any employment visas, at hiring or in the future, including but not limited to H-1B visas.      Responsibilities :  The successful candidate must demonstrate:  · Experience with using data from various remote sensing systems.  · Experience with satellite data assimilation techniques.  · Experience with ArcGIS, ENVI, QGIS, GDAL or Python for geospatial data processing.  · Experience in running Machine Learning and Deep Learning models using remote sensing data.  · Strong coding skills in Python and R.  · Perform spatial analysis and validation  · Ability to develop databases for remote sensing/geospatial projects  · Proficient documentation of applied scientific and technical research  · Excellent communication and technical writing skills.  · Ability to handle multiple tasks and coordinate with other team members effectively  · Strong data visualization skills   Qualifications:    · Experience with high-performance computing.  · Experience with AI software such as Tensorflow, PegaPlatform, Azure ML, Google Cloud AI, etc  · Experience working in Google Earth Engine and Descartes Labs platforms  · Experience with version control systems, such as Gitlabs or Bitbucket.  · PhD or MS in GIS/ Remote Sensing, Computer Science or similar degree with 3 -5 years professional experience.   Who we are  Lifescale Analytics helps life science organizations maximize the value of information assets to enable research innovation, increase efficiency, and ultimately improve the time that ideas in the lab come to life.  We provide the expertise for making observations, orienting data, analyzing information, and ultimately making decisions and taking action. Our specialists are skilled at managing, refining, analyzing or visualizing information for the specific purpose of increasing the value of IT for those in the life sciences industry. We achieve this through a progressive refinement of data along the analytics value chain. For more information, please visit our website at www.lifescaleanalytics.com  Job Type: Contract  Experience:   ArcGIS, ENVI, QGIS, GDAL: 3 years (Required)  Gitlabs or Bitbucket: 1 year (Preferred)  Python and R: 3 years (Required)  TensorFlow, PegaPlatform, Azure: 3 years (Required)  Machine Learning & Deep Learning: 3 years (Required)   Education:   Master's (Preferred)   Location:   Raleigh, NC (Required)   Work authorization:   United States (Required)   Contract Length:   More than 1 year   Contract Renewal:   Likely   Work Location:   One location    ]

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: [  Data Scientist - Machine Learning    This position goes far beyond collecting, analyzing, and reporting on data. We are looking for someone with a deep knowledge of, and passion for Machine Learning who can look at data from many angles, make determinations and insights, and make recommendations for new products, services, and business models that build on our technical leadership and mission to create a healthier, safer life, for global citizens and a more sustainable environment for the future.    Whereas a traditional data analyst may look only at data from a single source like a CRM, youll often be using data from multiple disparate sources, and types gathered from thousands of global customers and smart machines around the world.     Responsibilities:      Build machine learning models using supervised and unsupervised modeling techniques   Prepare and present use cases, and business cases to technical and non-technical stakeholders and partners   Once use-cases are approved, automate the routine logics over a cloud-enabled service platform to maximize speed, efficiency, and delivery of insights   Explore and examine innovative ways to optimize the cost-to-analyze though an intelligent application of machine learning toolsets     Qualifications:      Masters degree with at least 2 years of relevant work experience, or Bachelors degree with at least 4 years relevant work experience.   Degree concentration in a quantitative or business discipline preferred.   Familiarity with machine learning tools and methods in a fast-paced business or research setting.   Advanced skill in supervised and unsupervised machine learning   Excellent verbal and team communication skills including ability to constructively interface with all levels of management and technical staff.   Excellent written communication skills, including ability to summarize complex technical information into compelling dashboards   Demonstrated analytical and organizational skills.   Demonstrated creative problem-solvingskills.      ]

title: Data Analyst
description: [   Job Description    Do you want to work on real world problems with smart, collaborative peers and leaders who are invested in your success? CapTech is looking for Data Analytics Consultants that are passionate about technology with a desire to solve our clients’ most complex business and technical problems. As a CapTech Data Analytics Consultant, you will enjoy working within a collaborative, team environment to help define and deliver innovative solutions to our clients.    Specific job responsibilities will vary by project role, but may include:    Work with clients to understand their business, data, and systems   Elicit and produce data requirements based on research and client interaction   Design, develop, and produce statistical and other analytic reports   Communicate with all levels of stakeholders as appropriate, including executives, data modelers, application developers, business users, and customers       Qualifications    Specific qualifications for the Data Analytics Consultant position include:    Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, MIS or equivalent combination of education and experience.   Strong knowledge of SQL and other querying languages (Hive, Pig etc.)   Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (Excel, R, SAS, etc.) preferred.   Demonstrated experience with data models, database design development, data profiling, and analysis tools, especially in a big data format   3+ years experience with the full Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) or Agile, specifically requirements definition and testing preferred   Strong knowledge of relational databases (Oracle, SQL server, Teradata etc.) and NoSQL databases (HBase, MongoDB, Apache Cassandra etc.)    Additional Information    We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. At CapTech we offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to:    Competitive salary with performance-based bonus opportunities   Single and Family Health Insurance plans, including Dental coverage   Short-Term and Long-Term disability   Matching 401(k)   Competitive Paid Time Off   Training and Certification opportunities eligible for expense reimbursement   Team building and social activities   Mentor program to help you develop your career     CapTech is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a culture of equality, inclusion and fairness — each foundational to our core values. We strive to create a diverse environment where each employee is encouraged to bring their unique ideas, backgrounds and experiences to the workplace.    Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly (we are not open to contract or “corp to corp” agreements). CapTech has not contracted/does not contract with any outside vendors in its recruitment process. If you are interested in this position, please apply to CapTech directly.   #LI-SA1    ]

title: Engineering Data Analyst
description: [   At Ingersoll Rand we are passionate about inspiring progress around the world. We advance the quality of life by creating comfortable, sustainable and efficient environments. Our people and our family of brands-including Club Car® , Ingersoll Rand® , Thermo King® , Trane® , American Standard® Heating & Air Conditioning and ARO® - work together to enhance the quality and comfort of air in homes and buildings; transport and protect food and perishables; and increase industrial productivity and efficiency. We are a global business committed to a world of sustainable progress and enduring results. For more information, visit www.ingersollrand.com .     Ingersoll Rand is a diverse and inclusive environment. We are an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to hiring a diverse workforce; including minorities, females, individuals of all sexual orientations and gender identities, individuals with disabilities, and United States qualified protected veterans.      The Role      Compression Technologies & Services is responsible for supporting the Global Services and Reliability Engineering team by analyzing data from multiple systems and providing business insights gleaned from this analysis. These opportunities could include potential new services offerings, identifying components and products needing improvement in their reliability, and the analysis of lab test results to determine if they meet the reliability requirements identified.      Principal Responsibilities         Use of field data to assist in the creation of predictive and prescriptive asset fault signatures.     Use of data to identify assets operating out of their intended range.     Identify and implement AI tools to utilize machine learning to provide insights on how to optimize asset operation to minimize cost and maximize reliability.     Weibull analysis of component subsystems to provide insights into the Aftermarket stocking strategy.     Use of warranty data to identify top causal parts so that corrective actions can be taken.     Lead development and implementation of "state-of-the art" practices and technology to achieve excellence in field data analytics.     Guiding the efforts of Engineering, Customer Service and Manufacturing through data analysis to continually enhance the features, reliability and performance of Ingersoll-Rand products.     Remain confident, courteous and professional in all situations requiring customer contact     Provide a high level of problem solving in both field and system related issues           Qualifications         Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Business or other related program.     At least 5 years of demonstrated experience in data analytics for industrial or commercial product settings.     Use of Alteryx, Tableau, and strong Excel analytics capability preferred.     Working knowledge of R, Python, and SQL languages     Exposure to cloud based databases, data compliance, & integrating 'big-data' into initiative that drive business decision.     Strong analytical background - must include ability to identify relevant data within the organization and analyze it creatively. Solid grasp of tools (spreadsheets, databases, statistical methods) for analyzing data combined with strategic thinking and financial analysis skills.     Ability to deal with ambiguity - will need to create scenarios of alternate outcomes and make recommendations about the implications of decisions based on limited and imperfect information     Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively interact with all levels of the organization     Practical experience in Warranty, Quality & Analysis required with Technical Knowledge of Industrial Equipment & Vehicles desirable     Strong proficiency with personal computers including Microsoft suite     Position requires respect of, and sound working relationships with senior management, field technical personnel, field service management, internal engineering and manufacturing.     Excellent written and oral communication skills needed along with ability to write basic reports     Must have ability to work effectively while acting under their own initiative with minimal supervision     A good working knowledge of Process Improvement / Lean thinking is an advantage          We are committed to helping you reach your professional, personal and financial goals. We offer competitive compensation that aligns with our business strategies and comprehensive benefits to help you live your healthiest. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse culture that engages as well as values the different backgrounds and experiences of our employee, which, in turn, spurs innovation, generates creative solutions and enhances our customer relations.     If you share our passion for inspiring progress-for bringing about bold shifts in how people, economies and societies operate-then you belong with Ingersoll Rand. Progress begins with you.   ]

title: MEMBER EXPERIENCE DATA ANALYST
description: [     Who is Foodbuy?    We are the industry leader in procurement and supply chain solutions. We are the subsidiary to the 6th largest company in the world (Compass Group PLC), yet Foodbuy has the feel of a small entrepreneurial Company. We pride ourselves on our ability to source and provide a variety of products and services that help our customers more easily, and cost effectively, run their businesses. Our compensation packages are competitive. And we are constantly growing, and we want our associates’ careers to grow along with us. This role will require an analytical skillset and clear communication to tell compelling stories about how our business is performing thru reporting. You will also drive completion of reports, communicate findings, and key initiatives with our distributor reporting. This role is responsible for adhering to established processes and standards that have been put in place. This position is located in  Alpharetta, GA  or  Charlotte, NC .     Tactical Detail:     Analyze Reporting and Compliance tools using Excel   Prepare key business analysis to assist functional leaders in decision-making processes. Investigate trends and variances compared to prior periods and forecast   Ad hoc financial analysis and special projects to support continued growth of business   Formulate new methodologies to drive efficiencies in reporting and analysis   Assist in the preparation and presentation of reporting metrics to senior management, business stakeholders and key Clients   Prepare executive level summaries based on analysis   Develop and publish monthly management reporting package   Support Account Managers in their day to day administrative activities   Onboard new member   Manage DCN, Hierarchy and Subscription for all members         Qualifications:     Intermediate knowledge of Excel required   Completion of undergraduate degree and/or equivalent business experience required   Financial or trend analysis experience preferred   Supplier and customer interaction experience preferred   Excellent communication and customer relationship skills are required   Excellent written communication skills   Detail-oriented   Analytical problem solving   Flexible/Adapts well to change   Collaborative – works well as a member of a team   Coordinate and organize resources in efficient and effective ways to accomplish larger strategies and goals   Strong verbal and written communications skills   Customer service focus: Values customers. Meet or exceed their requirements and be consistent with business priorities   Generate innovative, “out of the box” approaches and improved solutions that help create incremental gains in business results   Consistently displays strong integrity and ethics          Apply to Foodbuy today!     Foodbuy is a member of Compass Group USA     Click here to Learn More about the Compass Story         Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law.     Req ID:  348810   Foodbuy   MIRANDA CARTERET   SALARIED EXEMPT    ]

Job Summary    The Master Data Analyst position, reporting into Canteen (retail division), offers a unique opportunity to engage in impactful and complex projects in a fortune 500 company. As the largest division of Compass Group this position will have the opportunity to help shape and support the direction of the data team and roadmap. The Master Data Analyst is responsible for supporting a transformational team to redefine and improve the current data structure within the business. title: Data Scientist, ISC
description: [    Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity   The future is what you make it.   When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.   Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.   Are you ready to help us make the future?   Leverage Honeywell’s wide range of technology solutions to create advanced analytics and predictive models to solve complex problems in integrated supply chain (ISC). You will work directly with site leaders, engineers, SBG directors and VP’s to improve quality, cycle time, and energy consumption in our manufacturing and distribution facilities. This role will also use network modeling software to create an optimized distribution footprint for Honeywell. You will develop mechanisms for monitoring accuracy and delivery of analytical solutions to key stakeholders.   Key Responsibilities    Develop analytical solutions to improve operational efficiency in ISC sites   Create baseline and optimized supply chain network models and develop business cases to improve lead time, transportation costs, and fixed costs   Create inventory and scheduling models to improve planning effectiveness   Continuous improvement on model accuracy and processing performance   Balance stakeholder and customer expectations    YOU MUST HAVE    Bachelor's Degree   3+ years of experience developing predictive models in Python or R   1+ year of experience writing SQL and creating workflows in Paxata or Alteryx    WE VALUE    Experience using cluster computing to execute large models   Experience developing supply chain network models using LLamasoft Supply Chain Guru or LogicNet   Experience using API’s in automated data collection   Experience using data science solutions hosted on Honeywell FORGE (Domino, Paxata, Dremio, Informatica, Collibra)   Strong communication skills to influence leaders using predictive models   Global company working experience   Coursework in Data Analytics, Computer Science and Statistics    Additional Information     Category:  Integrated Supply Chain    Location:  300 S. Tryon St, Suite 500 / 600, Charlotte, NC 28202 USA   Exempt     ]

title: Data Scientist
description: [    PURPOSE OF ROLE:   The primary purpose of this role is to provide advanced analytical capabilities to support data science initiatives. The Data Analyst is responsible for designing, conducting, analyzing, and presenting government market research initiatives to drive and support the strategic objectives of the business. modeling efforts to understand customer behavior which helps build customer-centric business development strategy  Develop a thorough understanding of the Federal marketplace, government spending recommend solutions  Experience with Statistical programming software, BI tools, and marketing platforms  Good judgment and conceptual thinker with strong decision-making capability who actively seeks opportunities and proposes proactive solutions  Maintains strong research design skills and the ability to generate and test hypotheses. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point)  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Dynamics CRM   Compensation Range   Base Salary Range $30,000-$40,000  401k  Healthcare  Expense Reimbursement   Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $30,000.00 to $40,000.00 /year  Education:   Associate (Required)   Location:   Charlotte, NC (Required)   Work authorization:   United States (Required)   Application Question:   Advanced Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and Power Point). description: [     Req ID:   65374        At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.       NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business/Data Analyst to join our team in Charlotte, North Carolina (US-NC), United States (US).        Project Scope : Manage a strategic data warehouse platform in order to meet expanding regulatory reporting requirements. The Data Sourcing team acts as liaisons between the internal Corporate Treasury Data Steward team and upstream data sources partners and facilitates the communication and remediation of data incidents.    Responsibilities:     Managing the Enterprise Data Incident Management tool including the creation, organization, documentation, and presentation of internal documentation.  Facilitate interaction across the entire program, by specific product, as it relates to the intake, submission, and tracking of all data incident tickets.  Liaison between internal Project Management, Data Management, and Liquidity Management teams to determine root cause, proposed solution, business priority, and scheduled remediation.  Maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders and act as a liaison to various internal groups.  Role will develop into more traditional Data Sourcing roles and responsibilities which include the following:  Review business requirements and understand business concepts to communicate with potential data sources.  Work with internal stakeholders to communicate requirements to upstream sources.  Identify, review, and analyze potential upstream data sources to determine best-fit for data sourcing initiatives;  Provide consultancy services to enhance overall data sourcing framework.  Provide ad hoc financial, business, and process services in support of corporate treasury initiatives.    Job Requirements:     Strong communication skills.  Ability to handle multiple tasks and work in a flexible work environment.  Excellent team player who can build strong relationships across all levels of the organization.  Strong analytical skills, ability to think and act independently, detailed oriented and organized.  Ability to operate in a flexible and evolving/challenging business environment.  Experience in navigating a highly political environment.  Data Management experience – data sourcing, data analysis, data architecture, system flows.  Strong familiarity in working with Microsoft Office products.  Financial/Banking Industry Experience preferred, but not required.  Banking and/or Traded products knowledge preferred, but not required.  Familiarity with Basel III/CRD-IV regulation preferred, but not required.    Basic Qualifications:     3-5 years project management or business development experience.  BA/BS in Finance, Economics, Business Management, Computer Science or other related field.     INDFS         This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment.          About NTT DATA Services        NTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.       NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.       NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.      ]

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: [    Job Description     At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience.   Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.   Corporate Risk helps all Wells Fargo businesses identify and manage risk. The team focuses on several key risk types, including conduct, credit, financial crimes, information security, interest rate, liquidity, market, model, operational, regulatory compliance, reputation, strategic, and technology risk.The group provides leadership, enhances communications, assists with problem identification and solutions, and shares best practices. In addition, the group provides an enterprise-wide view of risk, assists management and our Board of Directors in identifying and monitoring risks that may affect multiple lines of business, and takes appropriate action when business activities exceed the risk tolerance of the company.   Wells Fargo Compliance is the company’s compliance independent risk management function, providing company-wide leadership, standards, support, and independent oversight to ensure that all front-line business groups abide by applicable laws, rules, regulations and regulatory guidance (regulatory requirements), meet compliance responsibilities, and manage compliance risks. Wells Fargo Compliance credibly challenges management decisions, business processes and activities, and evaluates and assesses adherence to applicable regulatory requirements. It provides appropriate analysis, reporting, and escalation to senior management and the Board of Directors, sets minimum standards for the company, and gives advice, guidance, and support for compliance risk management activities across the enterprise.   As part of the Conduct Risk Analytics team, the Analytic Consultant will be responsible for supporting the development, implementation, and execution of advanced analytics capabilities for Conduct Risk within Compliance, as well as working closely with broader Compliance Analytics team. The team member will be responsible for statistical modelling, text analytics, and ad hoc advanced query development necessary for the identification and resolution of conduct related risks spanning ethics (inclusive of conflicts of interest), sales practices, market conduct, complaints management, and insider threat.   Specifically, a successful candidate will:    Develop data driven analytics capabilities to identify anomalies, outliers, emerging trends and conduct risks across the Enterprise.   Leverage text analytics techniques to extract value and insights from unstructured conduct data.   Partner with other Corporate Risk and LOB stakeholders to develop, and enhance analytical capabilities related to Conduct Risk at the first line.   Work closely with AI (MD) CoE in model development and performance monitoring, including working on Model Development Documents   Partner with Corporate Model Risk to ensure alignment with relevant policies, guidelines, and best practice.    #LI-JB9     Required Qualifications        10+ years of experience in analytics, modeling or a combination of both; or a PhD in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 7+ years of experience in analytics, modeling, or a combination of both        Other Desired Qualifications      4+ years’ experience with SQL   3+ years’ experience with at least one of the following programming/computing software: Python, R or SAS   Have experience using Teradata Aster, especially its Text analytics functions or SAS Text-miner   Had previous training/academic focus on natural language processing, text mining and text analytics   Experience in fraud, BSA/AML, investigations of financial crimes transactions or policy violations, risk management or compliance.   Experience accessing/acquiring Wells Fargo operational data for analysis.   Demonstrated experience leading advanced analytics projects.   Experience running data analytics against Wells Fargo data.   Experience working with Wells Fargo’s compliance policies and procedures.   Strong interpersonal communication skills.   Proven experience in building partnerships, collaborating and influencing at senior levels and across lines of business as well as with Corporate partners.        Job Expectations        Ability to travel up to 10% of the time        Disclaimer     All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.    Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.    Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.     CORPORATE RISK  ]

title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst

At least two years' experience with data modeling, data analytics or data science.  Advanced knowledge of the principles and practices of university operation desired.  Ability to work on a variety of tasks simultaneously and with frequent interruptions.  Knowledge of data standards and management related to ERP systems.  Understanding of data extraction methods, software applications and business logic and a thorough understanding of data warehousing concepts/frameworks. Women, minorities, and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.    ]

title: Sr Digital Data Analyst - Charlotte,NC
description: [          Dentsply Sirona is the world’s largest manufacturer of professional dental products and technologies, with a 130-year history of innovation and service to the dental industry and patients worldwide. Dentsply Sirona develops, manufactures, and markets a comprehensive solutions offering including dental and oral health products as well as other consumable medical devices under a strong portfolio of world class brands. Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY.       Bringing out the best in people       As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us.      Working at Dentsply Sirona you are able to:       Develop faster  - with our commitment to the best professional development.       Perform better  - as part of a high-performance, empowering culture.       Shape an industry  - with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.       Make a difference  -by helping improve oral health worldwide.            Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Site Operations & Merchandising, the  Sr. Digital Data Analyst  is responsible for designing the product taxonomy, defining product attributes, and ensuring quality and integrity for product data on dentsplysirona.com. The role will support projects to optimize product attributes for the overall product taxonomy. S/he will also field ad-hoc requests from across the enterprise for changes necessary to support various business functions. The role will be responsible for conducting competitive/industry research, building product knowledge in assigned categories, and planning/executing changes to product attributes and the product taxonomy. S/he combines commercial and product-focused thinking with strong communication, collaboration, and analytical skills.      Key responsibilities include:    Provides subject matter expertise for assigned product/functional area. Addresses product data collection & quality issues, documentation, system training needs & questions for both internal & external customers. Develops & maintains day-to-day relationships with internal & external partners to support product data initiatives.   Works with leadership to prioritize department projects and deliverables.   Implements product data projects and provides status updates. Keeps projects on-task and within expectations of project time lines. Ensures deliverables and goals for area of responsibility are met or exceeded.   Measures ongoing effectiveness of programs against metric targets. Develops and executes ongoing enhancement/optimization strategy based on measured performance and customer feedback.   Trouble shoots and problem solves for ongoing operational needs as they arise, i.e. product data quality collection initiatives and/or clean up, system error troubleshooting and gathering of system enhancement requirements.   Identifies legal requirements associated with assigned product functional area.   Authors and facilitates clear, concise end user/training on product data processes, system features and enhancements.   Coordinates integrated teams from one or more external agencies or functional organizations in support of managed initiatives. Reports on best practices and industry standards.       The successful candidate will have 3 to 5 years product data management experience, preferably within eCommerce and in a multi-channel B2B, B2C retail or consulting environment.   Highly collaborative, this key contributor will have a record of partnering with cross-functional teams across the organization to achieve commitments. S/he will also be an effective and nuanced communicator, comfortable speaking in groups and driving consensus on key considerations. This person will have a participated in creative problem solving activities to make steady progress towards achieving broader goals.      Competencies:   In addition to relevant industry background and functional skills, the key competencies of the ideal candidate include:    Results Orientation  – The ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability, determination, and tenacity to effectively support the execution of Dentsply Sirona's eCommerce strategic objectives. Given the Company's growth objectives and the strategic priority of the online business, the individual we seek is needs to be flexible and not afraid to call out data anomalies.    Subject Matter Expertise  – The successful candidate should have exposure to eCommerce within a dynamic, consumer-driven multi-channel or direct-to-consumer organization. S/he will bring analytical mindset and broad thinking, with the ability to pull together different ideas and components into a larger vision. The ideal candidate will be a natural problem solver and can think through & guide others around priorities, potential risks and trade-offs.    Collaboration and Influencing  – This individual will be highly collaborative. A key skill will be the ability to partner and communicate with business stakeholders and technology leadership to define, scope and execute Dentsply Sirona digital initiatives. This will require the development of effective relationships up, down and across the organization to establish alignment on strategic initiatives.    Analytical Thinking  – The successful candidate must have an analytical mindset and must use data to support decision making.      Key Qualifications and Experience    Bachelor's degree required.   Minimum of 3 years’ experience managing complex product data catalogs   Experience working with business & technical teams to solve complex product data challenges   Exposure to working with remote team members and working across geographies and time zones is required.   The ability to learn the latest technology trends, industry best practices, suite of vendor/technology solutions/options.   Excellent verbal and written communications skills accompanied by a strong business background, business operations, process improvement, and change impact.   Excellent verbal and written communications skills accompanied by a strong business and technical background, business operations, process improvement,       The position is located in Charlotte, NC.   Expected travel 10%            Dentsply Sirona is an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, disability, or protected Veteran status. We appreciate your interest in Dentsply Sirona.   If you need assistance with completing the online application due to a disability, please send an accommodation request to careers@dentsplysirona.com . Please be sure to include “Accommodation Request” in the subject.          ]

title: Data Scientist II
description: [     Job Description:      Job Description The Chief Data Scientist Organization is looking for a strong quantitative research associate that has a rare and unique combination of skills to serve on the THOR Engineering team. This individual will have primary responsibility our THOR GWIM information product. Initially, the focus will be on completing the build out of THOR GWIM which will involve bringing in the remaining transaction types for Merrill Cash Management Accounts (CMAs) that are not yet included in THOR GWIM. The individual will also be responsible for overseeing the regular THOR GWIM production enhancement releases that occur three time a year on data updated daily. This individual will need to be able to engage proactively with business partners in an effective manner to keep current with knowledge about new Merrill and Bank of America products, features and services, as well as in house technology and information systems that may have an impact on the financial transaction data captured in THOR GWIM. This person will also need to have an encyclopedic knowledge of the US marketplace and economy, particularly around investing and competitor investment firms. Once the THOR GWIM product has reached a level of parity with THOR, in terms of transaction scope and coverage, we would look to this to be involved with efforts to bring insights gleaned from appropriate machine learning and deep learning techniques to overhauling the current rule-based value assignment processes used by THOR and THOR GWIM. Finally, this person will be expected to provide ad hoc analytical user support to the THOR and THOR GWIM user community as needed, as well as training and informational presentations on a periodic basis.      Key Responsibilities:     Serve as product owner of the THOR GWIM information product   Complete build-out of the THOR GWIM product bringing in additional transactions to cover missing channels and activity   Master and understand the distributional nuances of the four million Merrill Cash Management Account financial transactions that come into THOR GWIM over the course of a month   Determine what product enhancements should to be made to THOR GWIM for each production release and take direct responsibility for coding up some portion of those release items for delivery to our production team   Ensure the highest level of quality through careful attention to detail in all stages of work from analysis and design to coding and post-production validation   Personally know every aspect of the THOR GWIM database better than any downstream user of the THOR GWIM product   Communicate findings, gaps and opportunities to all levels of the organization T   Take projects from ideation to data analysis to production and presentation Introduce a   learning laborator   approach to evaluate NLP, machine learning, and deep learning approaches as possible alternatives to the current deterministic approach for categorizing transactions and other THOR GWIM value-added attributes Required Skills, Background and Personal Characteristics for Success:   3+ years prior experience working with Merrill data   Graduate degree in social sciences or data science   Strong programming skills   Experience working with Teradata table structures   Extensive experience with statistical, machine learning and deep learning techniques (e.g., modeling, clustering, random forest, neural nets)   Formal training in research methodology/design of experiments   Informed awareness of major players in the US and world economies, particularly competitor brokerage firms   Knowledge of payment and transaction trends in the financial services industry   Strong attention to detail and curiosity about data anomalies   Ability to correctly discern subtle patterns where others might sense only noise   Ability to make rapid choices and decisions when presented with incomplete and ambiguous information   Ability to integrate diverse information sources, tools and techniques into production proc       Shift:   1st shift (United States of America)     Hours Per Week:   40   ]

title: PROSPECTNG DATA SCIENTIST - SUPPORTING SALES
description: [  As Segra continues its impressive growth trajectory, we are developing a world-class commercial operations capability. We are seeking a Prospecting Database Scientist as an addition to this dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be one who thrives managing and analyzing data to make a direct impact on the success of the sales organization.    The Prospecting Database Scientist will directly impact the success of the Commercial Operations group by identifying opportunities to sell to new customers, grow share of wallet with existing customers, and defend against churn. Management, development and curation of the database will primarily consist of maintaining the accuracy of the database as the Segra network expands, and improving the overall enhancements to prospective and existing customer information. In addition to these primary functions, the role will support ad-hoc sales support initiatives within the Go-to-market Strategy and Sales Analytics team and the Commercial Operations group as a whole. The Prospecting Database Scientist will also work with other Segra functions and external vendors to ensure the prospecting database continues to provide the most complete and accurate data.     Key responsibilities include:      Managing and analyzing the prospecting database   Support ad-hoc sales support initiatives   Maintain integrity of data feeds     The ideal candidate will possess the following qualities:  Education:      Bachelor’s degree in analytics, business, or related field; equivalent work experience; or a combination thereof     Experience:      3+ years of experience with Microsoft Excel, Lattice, and/ or related software applications to create models above and beyond basics of reporting   Experience with SQL and Alteryx (or other big data analytics tools), as well as with different ‘big data’ modeling techniques   Sales experience and familiarity with the B2B telecom sales process preferred     Key Competencies:      Excellent analytical skills; able to confidently work with data in Excel and other programs to draw valuable insights   Strong technical skills; able to quickly become proficient in new software programs   Proficient vendor/data management skills; ability to work with vendors and internal data owners to identify high value datasets to merge with the prospecting database   Intellectual curiosity; strong desire to develop new skills and understand complex data sets   Team player able to work effectively across the team and organization to gather data, communicate analysis, and collaboratively solve problems    We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.  ]

title: Senior Sustainable Investment Data Analyst
description: [   Our client is a diversified international market infrastructure and capital markets business with history tracing back to 1698.The Group operates a broad range of international equity, bond and derivatives markets, including LSEG, Borsa Italiana, MTS, Europe's leading fixed income market; and Turquoise, a pan-European equities MTF. They also offer Post trade and risk management services. They are a global leader in indexing and analytic solutions and are a leading developer of high performance trading platforms and capital markets software for customers around the world. They are headquartered in London, with significant operations in North America, Italy, France and Sri Lanka, the Group employs approximately 4,700 people.  This is a full-time position directly with the client and comes with excellent benefits.   Responsibilities and Duties    Use deep subject matter expertise to Analyze, Extract, Standardize & Maintain quantitative and qualitative data from multiple information sources including annual reports, websites, and other filings of public and private companies to a high degree of quality following defined policies and business rules  Develop excellent subject matter expertise on various parts of our data methodology  Identify and suggest ideas for reducing effort spent on data management and analysis by using automation or by process optimization  Contribute towards developing and maintaining methodology guidance and quality manuals  The ability to work effectively with peers, research analysts, and manager – both within the team as well as other teams in multiple time zones.  Design & Execute key proactive data quality controls to minimize risk by investigation and resolving data exceptions and breaks  Train & Mentor Data Standardization Analysts, perform Quality Control and provide specific feedback to improve quality over time. Report on results to managers, including root cause and actions plans for improvement  Develop strong subject matter expertise on how data is used by stakeholders and clients and ensure that internal processes align to deliver customer satisfaction  Resolve and answer client questions in an accurate and timely manner, by collaboration with Customer Engagement, Product and Technology as required  Lead virtual teams in activities to reduce effort spent on data management and analysis by using automation or by process optimization, often by use of 6Sigma or similar industry standard tools  Own key processes end to end, and develop and maintain methodology guidance, & quality rules and documentation  Work effectively with peers, research analysts, and manager – both within the team as well as other teams in multiple time zones.    Required Experience and Qualifications   This is an Individual Contributor role · Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience · Excellent numerical ability, attention to detail and the ability to collect and analyse large datasets. · Experience working in report creation, modelling, and trend forecasting · Excellent English Language Skills (write, read, talk) · Excellent problem-solving skills · Ability to work independently with high degree of ownership · Ability to meet strict weekly timeliness and quality standards established by the department · Ability to multi-task and be results driven Preferred Skills · Experience with ESG factors, carbon expertise and sustainability · Languages skills like Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Spanish, French  Qualified resumes would go directly to the hiring manager. This is an immediate position and our client is highly motivated to make a hire.  For immediate consideration please contact our recruiter Kavita at 703.673.0745  Job Type: Full-time   ]

title: Financial/Data Analyst
description: [     PURPOSE OF POSITION    Analyze and determine drivers behind financial statement variances. Prepare budget and forecast calculations. Utilize large volumes of data to develop and maintain reports.    ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:    1. Financial Analysis:   a. Prepare budget, forecast and other projections, working closely with other departments   b. Analyze financial results against prior year, budget and forecast   c. Prepare variance analysis and determine drivers   d. Identify patterns and trends in financial performance   2. Data analysis:   a. Manipulate large data sets to obtain meaningful information for Accounting team   b. Recommend and implement data driven process improvements   3. Reporting:   a. Work in cross-functional teams to develop enterprise wide reporting functionality   b. Develop/maintain reports for budget, forecast and accounting purposes   4. Special projects as assigned    REQUIREMENTS    1. Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance   2. Minimum of 2 years’ experience with financial analysis and forecasting   3. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills   4. Excellent time management and organizational ability   5. Strong Microsoft Excel skills, including pivot tables and advanced formulas   6.
